column7: Control Description

column6: Understanding the organization and its context
column7: The organization shall determine external and internal issues that are relevant to its purpose and that affect its ability to achieve the intended outcome(s) of its AI management system.
column8: To ensure the organization understands the environment in which it operates.
column9: Has the organization determined external and internal issues relevant to its purpose and AIMS?
column10: Context of Organization Document; SWOT Analysis; Strategic Plan

column6: Understanding the needs and expectations of interested parties
column7: The organization shall determine: a) the interested parties that are relevant to the AI management system; b) the relevant requirements of these interested parties; c) which of these requirements will be addressed through the AI management system.
column8: To identify stakeholders and their requirements regarding AI.
column9: Have relevant interested parties and their requirements for the AIMS been identified?
column10: List of Interested Parties; Stakeholder Requirement Matrix

column6: Determining the scope of the AI management system
column7: The organization shall determine the boundaries and applicability of the AI management system to establish its scope.
column8: To define the boundaries of the AIMS.
column9: Has the scope of the AIMS been determined and documented?

column7: The organization shall establish, implement, maintain and continually improve an AI management system, including the processes needed and their interactions, in accordance with the requirements of this document.
column9: Is the AIMS established

column7: Top management shall demonstrate leadership and commitment with respect to the AI management system.
column8: To ensure top management is actively involved in the AIMS.
column9: Does top management demonstrate leadership and commitment to the AIMS?
column10: Management Meeting Minutes; AI Policy Approval

column7: Top management shall establish an AI policy that: a) is appropriate to the purpose of the organization; b) provides a framework for setting AI objectives; c) includes a commitment to satisfy applicable requirements.
column8: To provide high-level direction for AI management.
column9: Has an AI policy been established by top management?

column7: responsibilities and authorities
column8: Top management shall ensure that the responsibilities and authorities for relevant roles are assigned and communicated within the organization.
column9: To assign clear roles for AIMS.
column12: and authorities for the AIMS assigned and communicated?
column13: Job Descriptions; Org Chart; RACI Matrix

column7: When planning for the AI management system, the organization shall consider the issues referred to in 4.1 and the requirements referred to in 4.2 and determine the risks and opportunities that need to be addressed.
column8: To ensure risks and opportunities are addressed.
column9: Does the organization consider issues and requirements when planning the AIMS?

column7: The organization shall define and apply an AI risk assessment process that: a) establishes the risk criteria; b) ensures that repeated AI risk assessments produce consistent, valid and comparable results; c) identifies the AI risks.
column8: To identify and evaluate AI risks.
column9: Is there a defined and applied AI risk assessment process?
column10: AI Risk Assessment Methodology; Risk Assessment Reports

column7: The organization shall define and apply an AI risk treatment process to: a) select appropriate AI risk treatment options, taking account of the risk assessment results; b) determine all controls that are necessary to implement the AI risk treatment option(s) chosen.
column8: To treat identified AI risks effectively.
column9: Is there a defined and applied AI risk treatment process?
column10: Risk Treatment Plan; Statement of Applicability (SoA)

column7: The organization shall define and apply a process to assess the potential consequences for individuals and society that can result from the deployment or use of the AI systems.
column8: To assess the impact of AI on individuals and society.
column9: Is there a process for assessing AI system impacts on individuals and society?
column10: AI Impact Assessment Process; Impact Assessment Records

column6: AI objectives and planning to achieve them
column7: The organization shall establish AI objectives at relevant functions and levels. The AI objectives shall: a) be consistent with the AI policy; b) be measurable (if practicable); c) be monitored.
column8: To set and track measurable AI goals.
column9: Are AI objectives established

column7: When the organization determines the need for changes to the AI management system, the changes shall be carried out in a planned manner.
column8: To manage changes to the AIMS effectively.
column9: Are changes to the AIMS carried out in a planned manner?

column7: The organization shall determine and provide the resources needed for the establishment, implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of the AI management system.
column8: To provide necessary resources for the AIMS.
column9: Are the resources needed for the AIMS determined and provided?

column7: The organization shall: a) determine the necessary competence of person(s) doing work under its control that affects the performance of the AI management system; b) ensure that these persons are competent on the basis of appropriate education, training, or experience.
column9: Is the competence of personnel affecting AIMS performance determined and ensured?

column7: Persons doing work under the organization’s control shall be aware of: a) the AI policy; b) their contribution to the effectiveness of the AI management system.
column9: Are persons aware of the AI policy and their contribution to AIMS?

column7: The organization shall determine the internal and external communications relevant to the AI management system.
column9: Are internal and external communications relevant to AIMS determined?

column7: The organization’s AI management system shall include: a) documented information required by this document; b) documented information determined by the organization as being necessary for the effectiveness of the AI management system.
column9: Does the AIMS include required and necessary documented information?

column7: When creating and updating documented information, the organization shall ensure appropriate: a) identification and description; b) format and media; c) review and approval for suitability and adequacy.
column8: To ensure proper creation and updating of documents.
column9: Are documented information appropriately identified
column13: Document Control Procedure; Document Review Records

column7: Documented information required by the AI management system and by this document shall be controlled to ensure: a) it is available and suitable for use, where and when it is needed; b) it is adequately protected (e.g. from loss of confidentiality, improper use, or loss of integrity).
column8: To ensure availability and protection of documents.
column9: Is documented information controlled and protected?
column10: Access Control Lists; Backup Logs; Document Versioning

column7: The organization shall plan, implement and control the processes needed to meet requirements, and to implement the actions determined in 6.1.
column9: Are processes planned

column7: The organization shall perform AI risk assessments at planned intervals or when significant changes are proposed or occur.
column9: Are AI risk assessments performed at planned intervals or upon changes?

column7: The organization shall implement the AI risk treatment plan.
column8: To execute the risk treatment plan.
column9: Is the AI risk treatment plan implemented?

column7: The organization shall perform AI system impact assessments at planned intervals or when significant changes are proposed or occur.
column9: Are AI system impact assessments performed at planned intervals or upon changes?

column7: measurement
column9: The organization shall determine: a) what needs to be monitored and measured; b) the methods for monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation, as applicable, to ensure valid results.

column7: The organization shall conduct internal audits at planned intervals to provide information on whether the AI management system conforms to requirements.
column9: Are internal audits conducted at planned intervals?

column7: Top management shall review the organization’s AI management system at planned intervals to ensure its continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.
column9: Does top management review the AIMS at planned intervals?

column7: The organization shall continually improve the suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of the AI management system.
column8: To enhance AIMS performance over time.
column9: Does the organization continually improve the AIMS?

column7: When a nonconformity occurs, the organization shall: a) react to the nonconformity and, as applicable: 1) take action to control and correct it; 2) deal with the consequences.
column9: Does the organization react to nonconformities and take corrective action?

column7: The organization shall document a policy for the development or use of AI systems.
column8: To provide management direction and support for AI systems.
column9: Is there a documented AI policy?

column7: The organization shall determine where other policies can be affected by, or apply to, the organization’s objectives with respect to AI systems.
column8: To ensure AI policy is consistent with other policies.
column9: Are other policies aligned with AI objectives?

column7: The AI policy shall be reviewed at planned intervals or additionally as needed to ensure its continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.
column8: To keep the AI policy relevant.
column9: Is the AI policy reviewed regularly?

column7: Roles and responsibilities for AI shall be defined and allocated according to the needs of the organization.
column8: To establish accountability for AI systems.
column9: Are AI roles and responsibilities defined?

column7: The organization shall define and put in place a process to report concerns about the organization's role with respect to an AI system throughout its life cycle.
column8: To enable reporting of AI-related concerns.
column9: Is there a process for reporting AI concerns?

column7: The organization shall identify and document relevant resources required for the activities at given AI system life cycle stages and other AI-related activities relevant for the organization.
column8: To manage resources for AI systems.

column7: As part of resource identification, the organization shall document information about the data resources utilized for the AI system.
column8: To ensure data resources are managed.

column7: As part of resource identification, the organization shall document information about the tooling resources utilized for the AI system.
column8: To ensure tooling resources are managed.
column9: Are tooling resources documented?

column7: As part of resource identification, the organization shall document information about the system and computing resources utilized for the AI system.
column8: To ensure computing resources are managed.

column7: As part of resource identification, the organization shall document information about the human resources and their competences utilized for the development, deployment, operation, change management, maintenance, transfer and decommissioning, as well as verification and integration of the AI system.
column8: To ensure human resources are managed.
column9: Are human resources and competences documented?

column6: Assessing AI system impact on individuals or groups of individuals
column7: The organization shall assess and document the potential impacts of AI systems to individuals or groups of individuals throughout the system’s life cycle.
column9: Are impacts on individuals/groups assessed?

column6: Assessing societal impacts of AI systems
column7: The organization shall assess and document the potential societal impacts of their AI systems throughout their life cycle.
column9: Are societal impacts assessed?

column6: Documentation of AI system impact assessments
column7: The organization shall document the results of AI system impact assessments and retain results for a defined period.
column9: Are impact assessment results documented?

column7: The organization shall operate and monitor the AI system in accordance with the requirements and specification.

column7: The organization shall provide information to users of the AI system to enable them to understand and use the AI system.
